title: Going Back-to-School with NASA Data
summary: As students head back to school, teachers have a new tool that brings NASA satellite data down to their earthly classrooms. For over 50 years of observing Earth, NASA’s satellites have collected petabytes of global science data (that’s millions and millions of gigabytes) – with terabytes more coming in by the day. title: Aura at 20 Years
summary: Introduction In the 1990s and early 2000s, an international team of engineers and scientists designed an integrated observatory for atmospheric composition – a bold endeavor to provide unprecedented detail that was essential to understanding how Earth’s ozone (O3) layer and air quality respond to changes in atmospheric composition caused by human activities and natural phenomena. title: NASA Mobilizes Resource for HBCU Scholars, Highlighted at Conference
summary: NASA will spotlight its program to engage underrepresented and underserved students in science, technology, engineering, and math at the 2024 National Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCU) Week Conference in Philadelphia, from Sunday, Sept. 15, to Thursday, Sept. 19. title: Space Force awards $45 million to universities for propulsion and power research
summary: To date the Space Force has invested more than $100 million in its University Consortium initiative

title: Investigation Identifies Cause of Ariane 6 APU Anomaly
summary: An Ariane 6 Launcher Task Force update has identified exceeded temperature limits as the cause of an APU anomaly during the rocket’s inaugural flight. Europe’s Ariane 6 rocket was launched for the first time on 9 July 2024 from the Guiana Space Centre. While the initial phase of the flight was completed as expected, an […]

title: NASA Veteran Kevin McCormick Joins Desert Works Propulsion as Senior Master Technician

title: Software fix planned to correct Ariane 6 upper stage issue
summary: European officials say a software change should correct a problem on the inaugural Ariane 6 launch in July that prevented the rocket’s upper stage from performing a final maneuver.
